properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 5 at 1:19AM CST until February 6 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH
THURSDAY AFTERNOON...

.Multiple rounds of moderate to heavy rainfall are expected
this afternoon through Thursday afternoon as showers and
thunderstorms move across much of Central Alabama. Rainfall
totals of 2 to 4 inches are possible, with locally higher amounts.
This will result in the potential for flooding of streams and low
lying areas, as well as isolated flash flooding.

The National Weather Service in Birmingham has expanded the

* Flash Flood Watch to include portions of east central Alabama
and southeast Alabama, including the following areas, in east
central Alabama, Russell. In southeast Alabama, Barbour.

* From this afternoon through Thursday afternoon

* Multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms with 2 to 4 inches
of rain, with locally higher amounts possible.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON
